titleStmt.title: A narrative of the cruelties & abuses acted by Isaac Dennis, keeper, his wife and servants, in the prison of Newgate, in the city of Bristol, upon the people of the Lord in scorn called Quakers, who were there committed for the exercise of their consciences towards God with an account of the eminent judgments of God upon him, and his end / published for a warning to others, by some of those people who were sufferers under him.

publicationStmt.publisher: Published by the sufferers themselves, from Newgate Prison in Bristol, the 6th of the 12th moneth,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.

person.persName: the sufferers themselves, from Newgate Prison
